title: pvp.net crash
body: Anyone know how I can fix PVP.net Patcher Kernel it stopped working and the game will not start

replies.body: I right clicked the LoL icon on my desktop and ran as admin and worked no problem.

Hey Akillez,

Is this a recent problem and has anything within your system changed? It sounds like you might have either permission-related issues which is causing the patcher to immediately crash upon launch, a connection issue which is failing to establish a connection to start patching, or the launcher is corrupted from a failed patching attempt. In either of the cases, the patcher may simply fail and error out.

If you've recently updated the OS or a third-party application which may interrupt the patcher's ability to launch (usually an anti-virus or a game launching platform), you may want to run the launcher in Administrator Mode straight from the League of Legends short-cut; details regarding how to accomplish this can be found here:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues#wq4

If that doesn't work and this happens on-and-off, you might want to look into resolving a possible connection issue. Here are some steps we have to resolve connection issues:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues#wq8

Otherwise, it could be a corruption with the launcher itself or if the game client is very out-of-date--let's say you've taken a break from League for a year and you're jumping back on. If that's the case, you may want to force it to re-patch. We've outlined how to do that here:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues#wq5

As always, if you're having issues after completing these steps or have trouble, feel free to contact my colleagues through the Support Site: 

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new
